info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 5:23PM MDT until August 08 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN YUMA COUNTY... At 522 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Yuma, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR YUMA, COLORADO AND SURROUNDING LOCATIONS. HAZARD...Baseball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Eckley. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 247 and 252. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a potentially deadly storm. Seek shelter in an interior room on the lowest floor of a well-built structure. Abandon vehicles in search of a more substantial permanent structure. Stay away from windows. This thunderstorm will produce damaging winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
